diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Flail mitral valve due to acute myocardial infarction of the papillary muscle in the absence of obstructive coronary artery disease.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The presentation of low-grade fever, hypoxemia, and pulmonary infiltrate was initially suggestive of various conditions potentially causing respiratory failure. Differential diagnoses were ruled out through thorough evaluation, including the patient's response to supplemental oxygen, the results of hemodynamic monitoring and echocardiography, which revealed flail motion of the mitral valve and evidence of myocardial infarction of the papillary muscle, particularly in the absence of obstructive coronary artery disease.
